Course Description: STUDY OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, INCLUDING INTERPRETING ACCOUNTING DATA AND ANALYZING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. OFFERED CONCURRENTLY WITH ACG 5XX1-1. GRADUATE STUDENTS WILL BE ASSIGNED ADDITIONAL WORK.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
STUDENT LEARNING OUTCOMES (SLO'S)	
INTERPRET THE ELEMENTS OF, AND THE INFORMATION CONVEYED BY FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
ANALYZE TRANSACTIONS AND THEIR FINANCIAL STATEMENT EFFECTS.
EVALUATE ACCRUAL BASIS BALANCE SHEETS AND INCOME STATEMENTS.
RECOGNIZE THE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE ACCRUAL BASIS BALANCE SHEETS, INCOME STATEMENTS, THE STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS, AND TO THE STATEMENT OF STOCKHOLDERS’ EQUITY.
USE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO COMPUTE THE PROFITABILITY, LIQUIDITY AND SOLVENCY OF A FIRM.
USE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO ANALYZE THE PROFITABILITY, LIQUIDITY AND SOLVENCY OF A FIRM.
APPRAISE HOW VARIOUS ACCOUNTING POLICIES AND METHODS IMPACT THE FINANCIAL ANALYSIS OF A FIRM.
IDENTIFY HOW THE DISCLOSURES IN THE NOTES TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IMPACT THE FINANCIAL ANALYSIS OF A FIRM.
ANALYZE RELEVANT FINANCIAL INFORMATION, FORMULATE CONCLUSIONS FROM THIS ANALYSIS, AND COMMUNICATE THIS INFORMATION IN A WRITTEN FORMAT.

TOPICS	
FRAMEWORK FOR FINANCIAL STATEMENT ANALYSIS
REVIEW OF BUSINESS ACTIVITIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
PROFITABILITY ANALYSIS AND INTERPRETATION
CREDIT RISK ANALYSIS AND INTERPRETATION
REVENUE RECOGNITION AND OPERATING INCOME
ASSET RECOGNITION AND OPERATING ASSETS
LIABILITY RECOGNITION AND NONOWNER FINANCING
EQUITY RECOGNITION AND OWNER FINANCING
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
